intro: Setaria verticillata, commonly known as false rice, is a grass species native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny seeds. It is often found in wetland environments and can thrive in flooded soils. Due to its rapid growth and adaptability, it is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
